roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: The FedRAMP PMO resides within GSA and supports agencies and cloud service providers through the FedRAMP authorization process and maintains a secure repository of FedRAMP authorizations to enable reuse of security packages

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: Members of the JAB include the chief information officers (CIOs) from the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and General Services Administration. The JAB serves as the primary governance and decision-making body for FedRAMP.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.description: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: System Security Plan Approval
roles.description: he individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

roles.title: Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Name
roles.description: Cloud Service Provider used by the client

roles.title: Information System Owner
roles.description: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

roles.title: Authorizing Official
roles.description: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

roles.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual representing the authorizing official.

roles.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

roles.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

roles.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
roles.description: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

roles.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

roles.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

components.title: Tenable Scanning Tool
components.description: Tenable Vulnerability Management is a cloud-based platform that identifies, assesses, and prioritizes vulnerabilities across IT assets. It uses real-time threat intelligence and asset context to help organizations focus on and remediate the most critical security risks.
components.remarks: This is a scanning tool referenced as a source by a POA&M entry.

components.title: Qualys Scanning Tool
components.description: Qualys VMDR (Vulnerability Management, Detection, and Response) is a cloud-based platform that continuously detects, prioritizes, and remediates vulnerabilities across global IT assets. It combines asset inventory, vulnerability scanning, threat intelligence, and patch management into a single integrated workflow.
components.remarks: This is a scanning tool referenced as a source by a POA&M entry.

components.title: Fortify Resource Group
components.description: Central hub for managing security and compliance-related services within the CSO.

components.title: Fortify Authorization
components.description: Handles authorization processes, ensuring only authenticated and authorized users or services can access system resources.

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: The Fortify Authorization service implements several authentication methods to ensure secure access to the ACME Application. The primary methods used are:1. **Password-Based Authentication**: Each user is assigned a unique username and password, which is required for initial login. Passwords must meet complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all users accessing the ACME Application, especially for privileged accounts. This method requires users to provide an additional verification factor, such as a security key or a mobile authenticator app, after entering their password. This enhances security by ensuring that access is granted only when multiple forms of identification are verified.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO through Azure Entra, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in separately for each one. This is particularly useful for government agencies that may require integration with their existing identity management systems.4. **Session Management**: Users are required to re-authenticate after periods of inactivity (e.g., 15 minutes), and sessions will terminate if there is no response within five minutes of a prompt. This helps

props.remarks: The Approved 3rd Party Services SAAS implements several authentication methods to ensure secure access to its services. The primary methods used are:1. **Password-Based Authentication**: Users are required to create unique usernames and passwords for their accounts. Passwords must meet specific complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all privileged access, enhancing security by requiring users to provide additional verification, such as a security token or mobile authentication app, alongside their password. This is enforced through Azure AD and applies to both privileged and non-privileged accounts.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO capabilities, allowing users to authenticate through their organizational identity provider (IdP) using protocols like OIDC/OAuth 2.x. props.remarks: The Smarty API for address validation implements robust authentication methods to ensure secure access to its services. Passwords must meet specific complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all privileged access, enhancing security by requiring users to provide additional verification beyond just their password. This may include a second factor such as a security key or a mobile authentication app. MFA is enforced through Azure AD and is compliant with CISA standards for phishing resistance.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO integration via OIDC/OAuth 2.x, allowing users to authenticate using their organizational credentials, which streamlines the login process while maintaining security.4. **Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)**: Access permissions are predefined based on user roles, ensuring that users only have access to the resources necessary for their responsibilities. props.remarks: The Paychex API implements a robust authentication system to ensure secure access to its payroll services. The primary authentication methods used are:1. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all privileged access, requiring users to provide multiple forms of verification, such as a password and a second factor like a security key or mobile authenticator. This enhances security by adding an additional layer of verification before granting access to sensitive information.2. **Password-Based Authentication**: Users must create strong passwords that meet specific complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters. Passwords are masked during entry to prevent unauthorized viewing.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO through Azure Entra, allowing users to authenticate with a single set of credentials across multiple applications. This simplifies the login process while maintaining security.4. **Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)**: Access permissions are assigned based on user roles, ensuring that users only have access to the information necessary for their job functions. This principle of least privilege minimizes the risk of unauthorized access.5. **Session Management**: User sessions are monitored and automatically locked after a period of inactivity (15 minutes). components.title: SendGrid (API)
components.description: Email services.

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: Authentication for the SendGrid (API) service is implemented through a combination of password-based authentication, multi-factor authentication (MFA), and single sign-on (SSO) mechanisms. 1. **Password-Based Authentication**: Users are required to create unique usernames and passwords for their accounts. Strong password policies are enforced, requiring passwords to include a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all privileged access to the ACME Application and Azure resources. Users must provide a second form of verification, which may include security keys (like FIDO 2 Tokens) or other CISA-approved methods. This adds an additional layer of security beyond just the password.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO through Azure Entra, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in again. This is particularly useful for government agencies that require integration with existing identity management systems.4. **Session Management**: User sessions are monitored, and after a period of inactivity (15 minutes), users are prompted to re-authenticate. props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: ACME implements several authentication methods to ensure secure access to its Content Delivery Network (CDN) and associated web applications. The primary methods used are:1. **Password-Based Authentication**: Each user is required to have a unique user ID and password to access the ACME Application. Passwords must meet complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all privileged access, requiring users to provide an additional verification method beyond just their password. This can include security keys (e.g., FIDO 2 Tokens) or other CISA-approved methods that are phishing-resistant. MFA is enforced for both privileged and non-privileged accounts, particularly during remote access to the application.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: ACME integrates with Azure Entra for SSO capabilities, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in again. This is particularly useful for government agencies that may require integration with their existing identity management systems.4. **Session Management**: Users are required to re-authenticate after 30 minutes of inactivity or upon first login. props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: The ACME Application employs several authentication methods to ensure secure access to its services, particularly within the Azure environment. 1. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all privileged access to the ACME Application and Azure services. Users must provide multiple forms of verification, such as a password and a second factor like a security key (e.g., FIDO 2 Tokens). This requirement enhances security by ensuring that access is granted only after multiple verification steps.2. **Password-Based Authentication**: All users are required to have unique usernames and strong passwords that meet specific complexity requirements. Passwords must contain characters from at least three categories, including uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system integrates with Azure Entra for SSO, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in again. This is particularly useful for government agencies that require compliance with specific authentication standards.4. **Session Management**: Users are automatically logged out after 30 minutes of inactivity, requiring re-authentication to resume access. Additionally, after 15 minutes of inactivity, a prompt appears asking users if they are still present, and failure to respond

components.title: Azure System
components.description: Azure System is a Leveraged Auth System for package: Azure Commercial Cloud

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: In Microsoft Azure Commercial Cloud, authentication is primarily managed through Azure Active Directory (AAD), which supports various methods to ensure secure access to resources.1. **Password-based Authentication**: Users authenticate by entering their username and password. Azure enforces strong password policies to enhance security.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: Azure supports MFA, requiring users to provide additional verification (such as a code sent to their mobile device) alongside their password. This adds an extra layer of security to the authentication process.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: Azure enables SSO, allowing users to access multiple applications with one set of credentials. This is facilitated through AAD, which manages user sessions and tokens across integrated applications.4. **Conditional Access Policies**: Azure implements conditional access, which evaluates user context (such as location, device state, and risk level) before granting access. This ensures that authentication requirements can adapt based on the user's situation.These authentication methods are integrated into the Azure platform, providing a robust framework for managing user identities and securing access to cloud resources.

incorporates-components.description: Tenable Vulnerability Management is a cloud-based platform that identifies, assesses, and prioritizes vulnerabilities across IT assets. It uses real-time threat intelligence and asset context to help organizations focus on and remediate the most critical security risks.

Qualys VMDR (Vulnerability Management, Detection, and Response) is a cloud-based platform that continuously detects, prioritizes, and remediates vulnerabilities across global IT assets. It combines asset inventory, vulnerability scanning, threat intelligence, and patch management into a single integrated workflow.
